@ffdf2195  u need to add size of variable in struct student

It's actually a 800MHz RAM, because 6400(MB/s)/8(Bytes) = 800MHz. However, that RAM is restricted to operate only at 667 MHz. You might have noticed similar situation for your RAMs as well. Usually for a 4 GB RAM, the usable space gets restricted to 3.80 gigs. The remaining portion (0.20 gigs) is reserved for system and other architectural specifications.
@rock on  if it's a 800 mhz ram then why it is written as 667 mhz on the sticker?
Because the remaining is used ny system only
